channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree opposite 14 and 16 Oakway is leaning badly, 4th October
item.description:
The tree is threatening to go through the fence of 30 and 32 Scotts Lane and needs removing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakway, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous scaffolding tarp ripping off in storm, 4th October
item.description:
The large scaffolding tarp at 102 St John’s Wood High Street has started ripping apart in the storm. The wind keeps making it into “a sail”. Apart from causing a lot of noise, it looks like it’s increasingly becoming dangerous and may tear off completely. It may compromise the safety of the scaffolding, endanger pedestrians and traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St John's Wood High Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 sofa frames on grass area behind 16-26 Watersmeet Way, 4th October
item.description:
2 sofa frames were left here on 27/8/25. I reported the issue at the time and I have been told that they have been removed. They are still there, as can be seen in the photo I took from my first floor kitchen window. The green area is off if Copperfield Road Nd bordered by the gardens of 16-22 Watersmeet Way, Copoerfield Rd and the bungalow at 117 Thamesbank Rd. The sofas have now been there for a week. There were previously the sofa cushions there. They were removed and as soon as they were gone the sofa frames appeared. I am not sure how anyone thought that they had been removed. Please can it be dealt with asap or we will get more rubbish joining it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watersmeet Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Green Lanes, Harringay, London

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 4th October
item.description:
Overhanging brambles with sharp spikes, well across the pavement, at about the height of a child's eye. A school is just along the road so many children pass by. This is 49 Sydney Road Bexleyheath and appears to be an unoccupied house and there has been no signs of occupancy for a few years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydney Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Tree on the verge, 4th October
item.description:
Very large tree 20 meters high, and the tree is close to the road and close to falling down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Kevington Drive, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plane tree has cleaved at bowl of trunk., 4th October
item.description:
In effect the high winds have caused this to snap and spilt in two with the broken half of the tree falling into the front garden damaging the hedge and then falling on to car, can't tell if car is damaged yet, please see photos. What is left of the tree appears to be flexing in the wind and could be at imminent risk of breaking also, given that the structural integrity of the tree is now undermined. I reported the perceived risk from this tree on August 13th this year under ref 8021760, receiving a reply along the lines of 'no action required'.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street tree fell to strong winds, 4th October
item.description:
On October 4th, a tree on the street fell due to the winds, obstructing the sidewalk and part of the street. We need the council to send someone to remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Merewood Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, 4th October
item.description:
A large tree has fallen on Colne Road, blocking the pavement. This should be cleared as soon as possible to ensure safe access for residents, especially given the nearby school whose pupils may use this route.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colne Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of bags of rubbish, 4th October
item.description:
On Monday litter was picked. Then left on street in sacks. People are starting to fly tip onto sacks. There’s point picking rubbish then leaving the bags looking untidy and attracting tipping. There are bags along the whole street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
